intro: Hieracium stilbocephalum, commonly known as the shining-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of a central yellow disk surrounded by pale yellow to brown ray florets. Hieracium stilbocephalum is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
